content.text:
# 2012 Multishow Brazilian Music Awards

| network     = Multishow
| ratings     =
| previous    = 2011
| main        = Multishow Brazilian Music Awards
| next        = 2013
}}
The 2012 Multishow Brazilian Music Awards () (or simply 2012 Multishow Awards) (Portuguese: Prêmio Multishow 2012) was held on 18 September 2012, at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Ivete Sangalo and Paulo Gustavo hosted the ceremony.
Winners and nominees
Winners are listed first and highlighted in boldface.
Voted categories
The winners of the following categories were chosen by fan votes.
{| class="wikitable" style="width="
! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;"| Best Male Singer
! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;"| Best Female Singer
|-

** Di Ferrero
** Gusttavo Lima
** Luan Santana
** Michel Teló
| style="vertical-align:top"|
* Ivete Sangalo
** Ana Carolina
** Maria Gadú
** Paula Fernandes
** Pitty
|-
! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;"| Best Group
! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;"| Best Show
|-

** Aviões do Forró
** Banda Calypso
** Fresno
** Sorriso Maroto
| style="vertical-align:top"|
* Paula Fernandes
** Jorge & Mateus
** Jota Quest
** Luan Santana
** O Rappa
|-

! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;"| Earworm Song

*"Problemas" – Ana Carolina
** "Darte" – Ivete Sangalo

** "Quero Toda Noite" – Fiuk and Jorge Ben Jor
| style="vertical-align:top"|

** "Assim Você Mata o Papai" – Sorriso Maroto
** "Balada" – Gusttavo Lima
** "Ex Mai Love" – Gaby Amarantos
** "Menina Estranha" – Restart
|-

* Banda Tereza
** Banda Baleia
** Banda Dorgas
** Banda Valetes
** Banda Volk
|}
Professional categories
Winners of the following categories were chosen by members of the music industry.
{| class="wikitable" style="width="

! scope="col" width="50%" style="background:#EEDD85;"| New Hit

** "É" – Tulipa Ruiz

** "O Deus Que Devasta Mas Também Cura" – Lucas Santtana

| style="vertical-align:top"|

** Los Sebozos Postizos (Dengue, Jorge do Peixe, Lúcio Maia and Pupillo da Nação Zumbi)
